metadata.feature_description: Set content as master template for reuse across multiple module instances

steps.action: Logged in as SuperUser and enabled Edit mode
steps.expected: Page enters Edit mode with module editing controls visible
steps.actual: Edit mode enabled successfully with all HTML modules showing edit controls and Actions menus

steps.action: Clicked on HTML module Actions menu to look for 'Make Master' option
steps.expected: Find 'Make Master' option in Module Actions menu as specified in UI Location
steps.actual: Module Actions menu shows Settings, Export Content, Import Content, Help, Develop, Delete, and Refresh - no 'Make Master' option visible

steps.action: Reviewed code to understand when 'Make Master' appears
steps.expected: Understand conditions for Make Master feature visibility
steps.actual: Code analysis reveals Make Master only appears for orphaned shared modules - when a module was shared from another page but the original page/module was deleted. This is a recovery mechanism, not a proactive template creation feature. The feature shows as a warning message with 'Make this page as master?' link, not in Module Actions menu.

issues: The 'Make Master' feature is not accessible through the documented UI path (Module Actions > Make Master). It is actually a recovery mechanism that only appears when a shared module becomes orphaned (its master page/module is deleted).

The feature description 'Set content as master template for reuse across multiple module instances' is misleading - the feature is for recovering orphaned shared modules, not for creating master templates.
Cannot test the feature without first creating an orphaned shared module scenario (share module to another page, then delete original page/module).

observations: Code analysis (HtmlModule.ascx.cs lines 197-216) shows the 'Make Master' functionality only appears when: 1) Module is a shared module (_moduleController.IsSharedModule returns true), AND 2) The master tab/module no longer exists (IsOrphanedModule returns true).

The UI location 'Module Actions > Make Master' in the feature specification is incorrect. The feature appears as a warning message within the module content area with a clickable 'Make this page as master?' link.
Related localization text found in HtmlModule.ascx.resx: 'MasterPageNotFound.Text' = 'This module does not belong to the page, but its master page is not found. Make this page as master?'
The 'ShowMasterContent' property in EditHtml.ascx.cs (lines 76-83) is related to localization/language modules (DefaultLanguageModule), not the master template concept.
The MakeMaster API endpoint (HtmlTextProController.cs lines 93-110) simply updates the ContentItem's TabID to the current tab, claiming ownership of the content.
